java.lang.Object

javax.jcr.query.Row
Enclosing class:
RowIteratorImpl
 class RowIteratorImpl.RowImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.jcr.query.Row

Implements the Row interface, which represents a row in the query result.

Method Detail

getValues

public javax.jcr.Value[] getValues()
                            throws javax.jcr.RepositoryException
Returns an array of all the values in the same order as the property names (column names) returned by QueryResult.getColumnNames().

Specified by:
getValues in interface javax.jcr.query.Row
Returns:
a Value array.
Throws:
javax.jcr.RepositoryException - if an error occurs while retrieving the values from the Node.

getValue

public javax.jcr.Value getValue(java.lang.String propertyName)
                         throws javax.jcr.ItemNotFoundException,
                                javax.jcr.RepositoryException
Returns the value of the indicated property in this Row.

If propertyName is not among the column names of the query result table, an ItemNotFoundException is thrown.

Specified by:
getValue in interface javax.jcr.query.Row
Returns:
a Value
Throws:
javax.jcr.ItemNotFoundException - if propertyName is not among the column names of the query result table.
javax.jcr.RepositoryException - if propertyName is not a valid property name.

getNode

public javax.jcr.Node getNode()
                       throws javax.jcr.RepositoryException
Returns the Node corresponding to this Row.

A RepositoryException is thrown if this Row contains values from more than one node. This will be the case when more than one selector is included among the columns specified for the query.

Returns:
a Node
Throws:
javax.jcr.RepositoryException - if this query has more than one selector (and therefore, this Row corresponds to more than one Node) or if another error occurs.
Since:
JCR 2.0

getNode

public javax.jcr.Node getNode(java.lang.String selectorName)
                       throws javax.jcr.RepositoryException
Returns the Node corresponding to this Row and the specified selector.

Parameters:
selectorName - a String
Returns:
a Node
Throws:
javax.jcr.RepositoryException - if selectorName is not the alias of a selector in this query or if another error occurs.
Since:
JCR 2.0

getPath

public java.lang.String getPath()
                         throws javax.jcr.RepositoryException
Equivalent to Row.getNode().getPath(). However, some implementations may be able gain efficiency by not resolving the actual Node.

javax.jcr.RepositoryException - if selectorName is not the alias of a selector in this query or if another error occurs.
Since:
JCR 2.0

getScore

public double getScore()
                throws javax.jcr.RepositoryException
Returns the full text search score for this row associated with the default selector. This corresponds to the score of a particular node.

If no FullTextSearchScore AQM object is associated with the default selector this method will still return a value. However, in that case the returned value may not be meaningful or may simply reflect the minimum possible relevance level (for example, in some systems this might be a score of 0).

Note, in JCR-SQL2 a FullTextSearchScore AQM object is represented by a SCORE() function. In JCR-JQOM it is represented by a Java object of type javax.jcr.query.qom.FullTextSearchScore.

Returns:
a double
Throws:
javax.jcr.RepositoryException - if this query has more than one selector (and therefore, this Row corresponds to more than one Node) or if another error occurs.
Since:
JCR 2.0

getScore

public double getScore(java.lang.String selectorName)
                throws javax.jcr.RepositoryException
Returns the full text search score for this row associated with the specified selector. This corresponds to the score of a particular node.

If no FullTextSearchScore AQM object is associated with the selector selectorName this method will still return a value. However, in that case the returned value may not be meaningful or may simply reflect the minimum possible relevance level (for example, in some systems this might be a score of 0).

Note, in JCR-SQL2 a FullTextSearchScore AQM object is represented by a SCORE() function. In JCR-JQOM it is represented by a Java object of type javax.jcr.query.qom.FullTextSearchScore.

Parameters:
selectorName - a String
Returns:
a String
Throws:
javax.jcr.RepositoryException - if selectorName is not the alias of a selector in this query or if another error occurs.
Since:
JCR 2.0

checkSingleSelector

private void checkSingleSelector(java.lang.String useInstead)
                          throws javax.jcr.RepositoryException
Checks if there is a single selector and otherwise throws a RepositoryException.

Parameters:
useInstead - message telling, which method to use instead.
Throws:
javax.jcr.RepositoryException - if there is more than one selector.

getSelectorIndex

private int getSelectorIndex(java.lang.String selectorName)
                      throws javax.jcr.RepositoryException
Gets the selector index for the given selectorName.

Parameters:
selectorName - the selector name.
Returns:
the selector index.
Throws:
javax.jcr.RepositoryException - if the selector name is not a valid JCR name or the selector name is not the alias of a selector in this query.
